author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Income Tax revenue generated in the country is well used to implement various welfare programmes and development works, said M. Tirumala Kumar, Principal Commissioner of Income Tax, Salem.

The Union Government received Rs. 7 lakh crore every year through Income Tax, he said. Mr. Tirumala Kumar was speaking at a get-together of Income Tax assessees of Namakkal Range, here on Monday. In some of the developed nations the rate of Income Tax was very high, and in some Gulf countries there was no tax for the income earned by the citizens. The Income Tax rate in India was low.

The department could collect Rs. 476 crore as Income Tax from Salem, Namakkal, Dharmapuri, and Krishnagiri in the last fiscal.

The target for this fiscal from these districts was Rs. 569 crore, he said.At the interaction session that followed, officials clarified doubts of Income Tax assessees.
title: Meeting of tax payers held
